channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Litter, 26th February
item.description:
Elmers end Road, LBBromley shrubs at the junction of the entrance to Elmers End station. Please can you clear the thick litter that has has come off the road and pavements and built up in the shrubs. Please could this be done before the shrubs are in leaf again.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End Road, Elmers End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Selective parking enforcement, 26th February
item.description:
Ongoing selective parking enforcement in this location. A particular vehicle is parked in a 30-minute short-stay bay for extended periods every day without any enforcement action, while other vehicles in the same bays are issued PCNs and penalised. This inconsistent approach undermines public trust and prevents fair access to short-stay parking for residents, customers, and legitimate users. Please investigate why this specific vehicle is being repeatedly ignored, provide a clear explanation.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe New Road, Rotherhithe, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missed Bin Collection, 26th February
item.description:
My Bin Collection day was Wednesday 25 February and my household bin wasn't collected.. I left it outside my premises by 6.a.m that morning. The Operatives moved it to the side of the kerb bins but for whatever reason they didn't empty it.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Forburg Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot holes, 26th February
item.description:
I reported the pot hole on this road before and was emailed to say it's been resolved but the pot hole remains. It's still just past the new road resurfacing. Additional the speed bump has a pot hole in it or is poorly resurfaced. Please can you actually send someone to the road to look at the pot holes and road issues.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Heath Road, Crayford, Greater London
